e4: Transparency in financial reporting is essential for trust and stability. Shifting to a no-bias policy aligns with ethical principles, legal compliance, and long-term investor confidence. This move fosters fair business practices, allowing investors to understand the true value of the company's performance accurately.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize honesty and transparency. This means consistently presenting accurate financial information, even when it might be less favorable to management.  It also requires open communication with investors, addressing discrepancies upfront instead of relying on misleading practices or biased information. Ultimately, such a policy cultivates a stable foundation for trust between the company and its stakeholders.
e6: Yes, several follow-up questions come to mind. I would want to understand how this new policy will be implemented and supported within the company's operations and across all levels.
